abstracts.cdata!:
The violence of 1999 destroyed much of
            east Timor's rural sector, with farms destroyed,
            processing machinery smashed, tools stolen, and farm animals
            killed. Through the first agriculture rehabilitation
            project, the World Bank-administered trust fund for east
            Timor has helped communities get farm animals and farm
            tools, repaired small irrigation schemes and roads, and
            trained agriculture staff. A second phase of this
            initiative, approved in June 2001, aims to build on the
            successful community-based activities of the first project
            by improving food security for farm families and increasing
            agricultural production. More than a thousand radios have
            been given away to people living in 14 separate communities
            to ensure they can stay in touch with the issues facing
            their new nation.
